intro: Astragalus commixtus, commonly known as the mixed milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus commixtus is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
